intro: Pseuduvaria dielsiana, commonly known as the Diels' pseuduvaria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its small, simple leaves and clusters of small, white flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its fruits are small, fleshy berries that contain several seeds. Pseuduvaria dielsiana is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and along riverbanks.
